name: asherdan
text: A comment left by asherdan was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Zefiel, JTTuba, NotGodot, DiamondMonster, getawaykettle, GeyserShitdick, atticusonline, profbobo, usversusthem, littlefatdog, Pigs)

name: waddlerz
text: He's not exactly buried, hes got hella chubbies

name: greyfield
text:
But a comment like that by anyone else would have gotten no lames and perhaps even more chubbies.

I'm not saying everything asherdan produces is gold, but the man can't catch a break.

name: soticoto
text: Apparently he also can't make a single decent post without it immediately becoming a conversation about his lame-count and his not catching a break.

name: ravindra108
text: I was just thinking the same thing.

name: lolsworth
text: He brought it on his own pointy yellow head

name: ford
text: chubby   supportive reply for asherdan!

name: drago25
text: chubbie supportive reply for your avatar, sir

name: ferdinand
text: amen to that.  don't pull a plath, cornelius!

name: gumfish
text:
Oh god, that reminds me of my old huge stuffed bear (it looked more like a real bear than your standard toy bear, and I could sit in the goddamn thing's lap when I first got it).

My cousin and I were playing Hide the Bear, and he stuffed it in the oven and it got grease all over it. I've had the thing since I was like two, I was devastated!

But it washed off in the end and it turned out ok. :)
Also I don't really know why I posted this story at all but I do know that I need to take a trip to the attic for a bearhug.

name: gumfish
text:
It's not as huge as I remember it but I guess back then I was two years old and now I am two metres tall.
It's still got this kind of weight to it that just makes you want to throw it about and oh god I need to go get a blog or something

name: professorhazard
text: That weight is all thanks to dust mites.

name: woodenteeth
text: Dust mites wriggling through the Bear, the Bear looking like it's moving toward gumfish for that hug, gumfish totally ecstatic and horribly afraid at the same time...

name: unsentletter
text: ... "gumfish?!"  Er... what is this, then?

name: professorhazard
text: That would be the dude with the jumping Mario avatar.

name: gumfish
text: See, if you're chewing gum and blow a bubble, and it sort of looks like a pufferfish...

name: gournal
text: oh my gosh i can't stop laughing at all the things you are saying

text: I have a gas oven, and one time my younger brother crawled inside it when I was in the room. I figured he'd e fine. The only reason he is still alive is because my mom came in about three seconds later.

text:

(I will relish each and every lame I get for that, and rub them all over my body. I don't care. I had to say it.)

text: DAMN, Alexei!  What WON'T you say?!? (chubbied)

text: I like to think that the "the drill" includes both Teodor's critique and Mr. Bear's suicide attempt. Like he could just hand it over and say "you know where to find me." After T reads, he goes to gently turn off the gas and let Cornelius sleep off his shame.

name: godfatherofsouls
text: I have yet to witness a fortunate beagle micturation.

text: that beagle is a son of a bitch.

name: doomchild
text:
Pedantry does not become you, sir.

DC

name: woodenteeth
text: 5. For "I'll be in the oven". First time my 3 year Lit degree actually came in handy. Which is mostly depressing because the sentence that read "She killed herself by placing her head into a stove" only took a second or two to read.

text:
Sylvia Plath.

Crazier than all the Bronte sisters added together.

of the ear

name: heccibiggs
text:
WHY DID I GOOGLE THAT

AND MORE IMPORTANTLY WHY DID I FORGET THAT I HAD TURNED SAFESEARCH OFF

name: relaxing
text: please tell me there are not in fact cases of hpv of the ear

name: heccibiggs
text: I didn't know what HPV was, so that's all I Googled. I didn't stick around long enough to check everywhere, but I did see it of the hand... So I guess the ear is just a feasible.

name: zhankfor
text: Chubby for inadequate sex education.

name: cagliostro

name: projectiles
text: téodor is sympathetic to the girl's plight.

name: woodenteeth
text: favourite avatar EVER, this and the dancing T-Rex

name: cpnglxynchos
text: the synergy is ridiculous.

name: woodenteeth
text: Hah! I hadn't thought... nice.

name: salvar
text:
I enjoy the fact that it is not made clear precisely what Tom was doing. He leaves it all up to the reader's filthy, filthy mind.
I tried Googling for a definition of "mincturations", but it just suggested that I might want to search for "menstruation" instead.

name: lechatbotte
text:
Try "micturation" or "micturition". But I'll save ya' the trip: It's just a fancy Brit way of saying urination or pissing.

Point of Trivia: It is actually the source of the phrase "taking a mickey" (taking the micturations), and was thus the penultimate source of "slipping a mickey".

Needless to say (and yet here I am saying it!), Father's annoyance at finding her reading his woas will not be improved by the sudden awareness that he is standing in a rather smelly swamp of beagle piss.

Not to mention why I've always found "Mickey" Mouse to be an unusually amusing name....

name: cpnglxynchos
text: ...so what exactly is a Micky Finn??

name: tekende
text: This strip makes me feel weird. Kind of a milder version of the way I felt as I watched terrible things happen to Ben Stiller in Meet the Parents .

name: spicyponyhead
text: Does it make you feel weird in your Area?

name: tekende
text: It's more like in my stomach.

name: lucid
text:
I, too, tend to feel icky about comedy that derives from a person having horrible things occur to them for no reason.

That and comedy that derives from horribly contrived awkward circumstances.

name: aaron_haynes
text: A lot of Harry Potter has this same theme in mind.

name: theguitarhero
text: Looking back on this, I don't understand what Chris was getting at. Does he not like Lemony Snicket? If not, that is a shame because I'm sure the two would get along great, even though one is fictional.

name: mctanuki
text: I thought both Onstad and Cornelius could have done much, much better. But then, parody of parody is a very difficult game to play, I suppose.

name: carlyle
text:
Heh!
